' 'HOME AFFAIRS COMMITTEE.BRITISH NATIONALITY AND STATUS OF ALIENS BILL.Memorandum hy the Home Secretary.I a3k authority to bring In at once the attached Bill toamend the British Nationality and Statue of Aliens Act, 1914,(as amended in 1918) so as to enable the British nationality ofchildren and subsequent generations born abroad to be maintained at present only children of the first generation born of Britishparents out of British territory acquire British nationality.The new Act will enable British nationality, to be maintainedthrough successive generations by complying with certain conditions as to registration at birth and renewal of registra-tion by the persons concerned when they attain majority.Proposals to effect this amendment of the law were laid before \Ithe Conference of Dominion Prime Ministers in June last and theIprinciple was recommended by them to the favourable consideration of the Dominion; Governments. The concurrence of all theDominion Governments has now been obtained and I gave a promise 1, Iat the beginning of this month that immediate steps should beItaken to introduce the Bill. There have been urgent demands by the British communities in various foreign countries for the preservation of the British status of their descendants born abroad and there is generally a strong feeling in favour of the. necessity of this amendment of the law.
